text: Shirley Todd Huffman (July 22, 1928 â€“ July 1, 2018) was an American Republican politician. She was born in Dayton, Oregon. She later moved to Hillsboro, Oregon, where she served on the city council before serving two terms as mayor from 1985 to 1993. After leaving office, she was replaced by Gordon Faber and served on the board of directors for TriMet and as a development coordinator for the city. Huffman died on July 1, 2018 in Ventura, California from natural causes at the age of 89. ==References== ==Other websites== *"Hillsboro hopes to ride the light rail to prosperity" - Portland Business Journal Category:1928 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in California Category:American mayors Category:Politicians from Oregon Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
